fi

echo "Total: $SKILL_COUNT skills available"

echo "üìñ Skill docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/skills"
echo ""

# Discover Subagents
echo "ü§ñ SUBAGENTS"

AGENT_COUNT=0

# User agents
if [ -d ~/.claude/agents ]; then
    for agent_file in ~/.claude/agents/*.md; do
        if [ -f "$agent_file" ]; then
            agent_name=$(basename "$agent_file" .md)
            AGENT_COUNT=$((AGENT_COUNT + 1))
            
            echo "üë§ $agent_name (user)"
            
            # Extract description
            desc=$(grep "^description:" "$agent_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-80)
            if [ -n "$desc" ]; then
                echo "   Description: $desc..."
            fi
            
            # Extract tools
            tools=$(grep "^tools:" "$agent_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^tools: *//')
            if [ -n "$tools" ]; then
                echo "   Tools: $tools"
            fi
            
            echo "   Location: ~/.claude/agents/$agent_name.md"
            echo ""
        fi
    done
fi

# Project agents
if [ -d .claude/agents ]; then
    for agent_file in .claude/agents/*.md; do
        if [ -f "$agent_file" ]; then
            agent_name=$(basename "$agent_file" .md)
            AGENT_COUNT=$((AGENT_COUNT + 1))
            
            echo "üë§ $agent_name (project)"
            
            desc=$(grep "^description:" "$agent_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-80)
            if [ -n "$desc" ]; then
                echo "   Description: $desc..."
            fi

            if [ -n "$tools" ]; then
                echo "   Tools: $tools"
            fi
            
            echo "   Location: .claude/agents/$agent_name.md"
            echo ""
        fi
    done
fi

echo "Total: $AGENT_COUNT subagents configured"
echo ""
echo "üí° Create agent: Create .md file in .claude/agents/ or ~/.claude/agents/"
echo "üìñ Agent docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/agents"
echo ""

# Discover Custom Slash Commands
echo "‚ö° CUSTOM SLASH COMMANDS"
echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

CMD_COUNT=0

if [ -d ~/.claude/commands ]; then
    for cmd_file in ~/.claude/commands/*.md; do
        if [ -f "$cmd_file" ]; then
            cmd_name=$(basename "$cmd_file" .md)
            CMD_COUNT=$((CMD_COUNT + 1))
            
            echo "/$cmd_name (user)"
            
            # Extract description
            desc=$(grep "^description:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
            if [ -n "$desc" ]; then
                echo "  Description: $desc..."
            fi
            
            # Check for arguments
            args=$(grep "^argument-hint:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^argument-hint: *//')
            if [ -n "$args" ]; then
                echo "  Arguments: $args"
            fi

        fi

fi

# Project commands
if [ -d .claude/commands ]; then
    for cmd_file in .claude/commands/*.md; do
        if [ -f "$cmd_file" ]; then
            cmd_name=$(basename "$cmd_file" .md)
            CMD_COUNT=$((CMD_COUNT + 1))
            
            echo "/$cmd_name (project)"
            
            desc=$(grep "^description:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
            if [ -n "$desc" ]; then
                echo "  Description: $desc..."

            args=$(grep "^argument-hint:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^argument-hint: *//')
            if [ -n "$args" ]; then
                echo "  Arguments: $args"
            fi
            echo ""
        fi
    done
fi

echo "Total: $CMD_COUNT custom commands available"

echo ""

input.command:
# Discover Hooks
echo "ü™ù LIFECYCLE HOOKS"
echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

HOOK_COUNT=0

# Check user settings
if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.json ]; then
    HOOKS_DATA=$(cat ~/.claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null | grep -A 100 '"hooks"' || echo "")
    if [ -n "$HOOKS_DATA" ]; then
        PRE_TOOL=$(echo "$HOOKS_DATA" | grep -c "PreToolUse" || echo "0")
        POST_TOOL=$(echo "$HOOKS_DATA" | grep -c "PostToolUse" || echo "0")
        
        if [ "$PRE_TOOL" -gt 0 ] || [ "$POST_TOOL" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "Hook Types Configured:"
            [ "$PRE_TOOL" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PreToolUse:  $PRE_TOOL hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + PRE_TOOL))
            [ "$POST_TOOL" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PostToolUse: $POST_TOOL hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + POST_TOOL))
            echo ""
        fi
    fi
fi

# Check project settings
if [ -f .claude/settings.json ]; then
    HOOKS_DATA=$(cat .claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null | grep -A 100 '"hooks"' || echo "")
    if [ -n "$HOOKS_DATA" ]; then
        PRE_TOOL=$(echo "$HOOKS_DATA" | grep -c "PreToolUse" || echo "0")
        POST_TOOL=$(echo "$HOOKS_DATA" | grep -c "PostToolUse" || echo "0")
        
        if [ "$PRE_TOOL" -gt 0 ] || [ "$POST_TOOL" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "Project Hook Types:"
            [ "$PRE_TOOL" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PreToolUse:  $PRE_TOOL hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + PRE_TOOL))
            [ "$POST_TOOL" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PostToolUse: $POST_TOOL hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + POST_TOOL))
            echo ""
        fi
    fi
fi

if [ $HOOK_COUNT -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "No lifecycle hooks currently configured"
    echo ""
fi

echo "Total: $HOOK_COUNT hooks configured"
echo ""
echo "üí° Configure hooks: Edit settings.json or use interactive setup"
echo "üìñ Hook docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/hooks"
echo ""

# Discover Output Styles
echo "üé® OUTPUT STYLES"
echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

echo "Built-in Styles:"
echo "  - efficient       (Fast, direct coding assistant)"
echo "  - explanatory     (Teaching mode with insights)"
echo "  - concise         (Minimal, to-the-point responses)"
echo ""

STYLE_COUNT=3  # Built-in styles

# User styles
if [ -d ~/.claude/output-styles ]; then
    USER_STYLES=$(ls -1 ~/.claude/output-styles/*.md 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs)
    if [ "$USER_STYLES" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "Custom User Styles:"
        for style_file in ~/.claude/output-styles/*.md; do
            if [ -f "$style_file" ]; then
                style_name=$(basename "$style_file" .md)
                STYLE_COUNT=$((STYLE_COUNT + 1))
                
                echo "  üìù $style_name (user)"
                
                desc=$(grep "^description:" "$style_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
                if [ -n "$desc" ]; then
                    echo "     Description: $desc..."
                fi
            fi
        done
        echo ""
    fi
fi

# Project styles
if [ -d .claude/output-styles ]; then
    PROJECT_STYLES=$(ls -1 .claude/output-styles/*.md 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs)
    if [ "$PROJECT_STYLES" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "Custom Project Styles:"
        for style_file in .claude/output-styles/*.md; do
            if [ -f "$style_file" ]; then
                style_name=$(basename "$style_file" .md)
                STYLE_COUNT=$((STYLE_COUNT + 1))
                
                echo "  üìù $style_name (project)"
                
                desc=$(grep "^description:" "$style_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
                if [ -n "$desc" ]; then
                    echo "     Description: $desc..."
                fi
            fi
        done
        echo ""
    fi
fi

echo "Total: $STYLE_COUNT output styles available"
echo ""
echo "üí° Create style: Create .md file in .claude/output-styles/"
echo ""

**Productivity Boosters:**

- `/orchestrate-lite` - Automated task decomposition
- `/tools` - This command! üéØ
- Output styles - Adapt Claude's behavior per task

You're absolutely right to identify these issues! Let me analyze both problems and explore the shell script solution.

## Issues Identified:

**Issue 1: Tools not visible in output**
- The Bash tool results are getting collapsed/hidden in the UI
- You only see "ctrl+o to expand" instead of the actual tool listings
- This defeats the purpose of the `/tools` command

**Issue 2: Slow execution**
- Running 7+ sequential Bash commands takes time
- Each command has overhead (shell startup, parsing, etc.)
- Network latency between tool calls adds up

---

## Solution: Single Shell Script Approach

Let me explore creating a dedicated shell script:

#!/bin/bash

# Claude Code Tools Discovery Script
# Efficiently lists all available tools in the environment
# Usage: list-tools.sh [category]
#   Categories: system, mcps, skills, agents, commands, hooks, plugins, styles, all

CATEGORY="${1:-all}"

# Color codes (optional, remove if causing issues)
BOLD='\033[1m'
DIM='\033[2m'
RESET='\033[0m'

# Header
echo "‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó"
echo "‚ïë              CLAUDE CODE TOOLS DIRECTORY                       ‚ïë"
echo "‚ïë              Current Environment Capabilities                   ‚ïë"
echo "‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù"
echo ""

# Counters
SKILL_COUNT=0
AGENT_COUNT=0
CMD_COUNT=0
HOOK_COUNT=0
STYLE_COUNT=3  # Built-in styles
MCP_COUNT=0

# Function: List System Commands
list_system() {
    echo "üìã BUILT-IN SYSTEM COMMANDS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"
    echo "Core Claude Code slash commands:"
    echo ""
    echo "Session Management:"
    echo "  /help         - Show all available slash commands"
    echo "  /clear        - Clear conversation history"
    echo "  /context      - View current context usage"
    echo "  /compact      - Compact conversation history"
    echo "  /checkpoint   - Create conversation checkpoint"
    echo "  /resume       - Resume previous session"
    echo ""
    echo "Project & Configuration:"
    echo "  /init         - Initialize new project context"
    echo "  /model        - Switch between Claude models"
    echo "  /permissions  - View/modify tool permissions"
    echo "  /hooks        - Configure lifecycle hooks interactively"
    echo ""
    echo "Tool Management:"
    echo "  /agents       - Manage subagents"
    echo "  /skills       - Manage agent skills"
    echo "  /plugin       - Manage plugins"
    echo "  /mcp          - Manage MCP servers"
    echo ""
    echo "Run /help for complete list and details"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List MCP Servers
list_mcps() {
    echo "üîå MCP SERVERS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    local found=0

    # Check user settings
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.json ]; then
        local mcp_data=$(grep -A 50 "mcpServers" ~/.claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null)
        if [ -n "$mcp_data" ]; then
            local servers=$(echo "$mcp_data" | grep -E '"[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+":\s*{' | sed 's/.*"\([^"]*\)".*/\1/')
            if [ -n "$servers" ]; then
                found=1
                echo "Found MCP server(s):"
                echo ""
                while IFS= read -r server; do
                    [ -z "$server" ] && continue
                    MCP_COUNT=$((MCP_COUNT + 1))
                    echo "‚úì $server (user)"
                    echo "  Status: Configured"
                    echo ""
                done <<< "$servers"
            fi
        fi
    fi

    if [ $found -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "No MCP servers currently configured"
        echo ""
    fi

    echo "üí° Add MCP servers: claude mcp add <name> [args]"
    echo "üìñ Browse servers: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Agent Skills
list_skills() {
    echo "üéØ AGENT SKILLS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    # User skills
    if [ -d ~/.claude/skills ]; then
        for skill_dir in ~/.claude/skills/*/; do
            [ ! -d "$skill_dir" ] && continue

            local skill_name=$(basename "$skill_dir")
            SKILL_COUNT=$((SKILL_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üì¶ $skill_name (user)"

            if [ -f "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" ]; then
                local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
                [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            fi
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    # Project skills
    if [ -d .claude/skills ]; then
        for skill_dir in .claude/skills/*/; do
            [ ! -d "$skill_dir" ] && continue

            local skill_name=$(basename "$skill_dir")
            SKILL_COUNT=$((SKILL_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üì¶ $skill_name (project)"

            if [ -f "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" ]; then
                local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
                [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            fi
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    echo "Total: $SKILL_COUNT skills"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create skill: mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills/myskill && touch ~/.claude/skills/myskill/SKILL.md"
    echo "üìñ Skill docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/skills"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Subagents
list_agents() {
    echo "ü§ñ SUBAGENTS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    # User agents
    if [ -d ~/.claude/agents ]; then
        for agent_file in ~/.claude/agents/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$agent_file" ] && continue

            local agent_name=$(basename "$agent_file" .md)
            AGENT_COUNT=$((AGENT_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üë§ $agent_name (user)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$agent_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    # Project agents
    if [ -d .claude/agents ]; then
        for agent_file in .claude/agents/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$agent_file" ] && continue

            local agent_name=$(basename "$agent_file" .md)
            AGENT_COUNT=$((AGENT_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üë§ $agent_name (project)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$agent_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    echo "Total: $AGENT_COUNT subagents"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create agent: Create .md file in .claude/agents/ or ~/.claude/agents/"
    echo "üìñ Agent docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/agents"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Custom Slash Commands
list_commands() {
    echo "‚ö° CUSTOM SLASH COMMANDS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    # User commands
    if [ -d ~/.claude/commands ]; then
        for cmd_file in ~/.claude/commands/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$cmd_file" ] && continue

            local cmd_name=$(basename "$cmd_file" .md)
            CMD_COUNT=$((CMD_COUNT + 1))

            echo "/$cmd_name (user)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "  $desc..."

            local args=$(grep "^argument-hint:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^argument-hint: *//')
            [ -n "$args" ] && echo "  Arguments: $args"
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    # Project commands
    if [ -d .claude/commands ]; then
        for cmd_file in .claude/commands/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$cmd_file" ] && continue

            local cmd_name=$(basename "$cmd_file" .md)
            CMD_COUNT=$((CMD_COUNT + 1))

            echo "/$cmd_name (project)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "  $desc..."

            local args=$(grep "^argument-hint:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^argument-hint: *//')
            [ -n "$args" ] && echo "  Arguments: $args"
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    echo "Total: $CMD_COUNT commands"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create command: echo '# My Command' > ~/.claude/commands/mycommand.md"
    echo "üìñ Command docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/slash-commands"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Hooks
list_hooks() {
    echo "ü™ù LIFECYCLE HOOKS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    local found=0

    # Check user settings
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.json ]; then
        local hooks_data=$(grep -A 100 '"hooks"' ~/.claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null)
        if [ -n "$hooks_data" ]; then
            local pre_count=$(echo "$hooks_data" | grep -c "PreToolUse" || echo "0")
            local post_count=$(echo "$hooks_data" | grep -c "PostToolUse" || echo "0")

            if [ "$pre_count" -gt 0 ] || [ "$post_count" -gt 0 ]; then
                found=1
                echo "Hook Types Configured:"
                [ "$pre_count" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PreToolUse:  $pre_count hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + pre_count))
                [ "$post_count" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PostToolUse: $post_count hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + post_count))
                echo ""
            fi
        fi
    fi

    if [ $found -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "No lifecycle hooks currently configured"
        echo ""
    fi

    echo "Total: $HOOK_COUNT hooks"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Configure hooks: Edit settings.json or use interactive setup"
    echo "üìñ Hook docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/hooks"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Output Styles
list_styles() {
    echo "üé® OUTPUT STYLES"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    echo "Built-in Styles:"
    echo "  - efficient       (Fast, direct coding assistant)"
    echo "  - explanatory     (Teaching mode with insights)"
    echo "  - concise         (Minimal, to-the-point responses)"
    echo ""

    # User styles
    if [ -d ~/.claude/output-styles ]; then
        local has_custom=0
        for style_file in ~/.claude/output-styles/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$style_file" ] && continue

            if [ $has_custom -eq 0 ]; then
                echo "Custom User Styles:"
                has_custom=1
            fi

            local style_name=$(basename "$style_file" .md)
            STYLE_COUNT=$((STYLE_COUNT + 1))

            echo "  üìù $style_name (user)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$style_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "     $desc..."
        done
        [ $has_custom -eq 1 ] && echo ""
    fi

    # Project styles
    if [ -d .claude/output-styles ]; then
        local has_custom=0
        for style_file in .claude/output-styles/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$style_file" ] && continue

            if [ $has_custom -eq 0 ]; then
                echo "Custom Project Styles:"
                has_custom=1
            fi

            local style_name=$(basename "$style_file" .md)
            STYLE_COUNT=$((STYLE_COUNT + 1))

            echo "  üìù $style_name (project)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$style_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "     $desc..."
        done
        [ $has_custom -eq 1 ] && echo ""
    fi

    echo "Total: $STYLE_COUNT styles"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create style: Create .md file in .claude/output-styles/"
    echo ""
}

# Function: Display Summary
show_summary() {
    echo ""
    echo "‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó"
    echo "‚ïë                         SUMMARY                                 ‚ïë"
    echo "‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù"
    echo ""

    local total=$((15 + MCP_COUNT + SKILL_COUNT + AGENT_COUNT + CMD_COUNT + HOOK_COUNT + STYLE_COUNT))

    echo "Total Capabilities: $total items"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Built-in Commands: 15+"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ MCP Servers: $MCP_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Agent Skills: $SKILL_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Subagents: $AGENT_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Slash Commands: $CMD_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Hooks: $HOOK_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Plugins: 0"
    echo "‚îî‚îÄ Output Styles: $STYLE_COUNT"
    echo ""
    echo "üìñ Full Documentation: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/"
    echo "üí¨ Community: https://github.com/hesreallyhim/awesome-claude-code"
    echo ""
}

# Main execution logic
case "$CATEGORY" in
    system)
        list_system
        ;;
    mcps)
        list_mcps
        ;;
    skills)
        list_skills
        ;;
    agents)
        list_agents
        ;;
    commands)
        list_commands
        ;;
    hooks)
        list_hooks
        ;;
    styles)
        list_styles
        ;;
    plugins)
        echo "üîå INSTALLED PLUGINS"
        echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"
        echo "No plugins currently installed"
        echo ""
        echo "üí° Install plugin: /plugin install <name>"
        echo "üìñ Plugin docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/plugins"
        echo ""
        ;;
    all|*)
        list_system
        list_mcps
        list_skills
        list_agents
        list_commands
        list_hooks
        list_styles
        show_summary
        ;;
esac

# Claude Code Tools Discovery Script

CATEGORY="${1:-all}"

DIM='\033[2m'

# Header

echo "‚ïë              CLAUDE CODE TOOLS DIRECTORY                       ‚ïë"
echo "‚ïë              Current Environment Capabilities                   ‚ïë"
echo "‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù"
echo ""

# Counters
SKILL_COUNT=0
AGENT_COUNT=0
CMD_COUNT=0
HOOK_COUNT=0
STYLE_COUNT=3  # Built-in styles
MCP_COUNT=0

# Function: List System Commands
list_system() {
    echo "üìã BUILT-IN SYSTEM COMMANDS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"
    echo "Core Claude Code slash commands:"
    echo ""
    echo "Session Management:"
    echo "  /help         - Show all available slash commands"
    echo "  /clear        - Clear conversation history"
    echo "  /context      - View current context usage"
    echo "  /compact      - Compact conversation history"
    echo "  /checkpoint   - Create conversation checkpoint"
    echo "  /resume       - Resume previous session"
    echo ""
    echo "Project & Configuration:"
    echo "  /init         - Initialize new project context"
    echo "  /model        - Switch between Claude models"
    echo "  /permissions  - View/modify tool permissions"
    echo "  /hooks        - Configure lifecycle hooks interactively"
    echo ""
    echo "Tool Management:"
    echo "  /agents       - Manage subagents"
    echo "  /skills       - Manage agent skills"
    echo "  /plugin       - Manage plugins"
    echo "  /mcp          - Manage MCP servers"
    echo ""
    echo "Run /help for complete list and details"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List MCP Servers
list_mcps() {
    echo "üîå MCP SERVERS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    local found=0

    # Check user settings
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.json ]; then
        local mcp_data=$(grep -A 50 "mcpServers" ~/.claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null)
        if [ -n "$mcp_data" ]; then
            local servers=$(echo "$mcp_data" | grep -E '"[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+":\s*{' | sed 's/.*"\([^"]*\)".*/\1/')
            if [ -n "$servers" ]; then
                found=1
                echo "Found MCP server(s):"
                echo ""
                while IFS= read -r server; do
                    [ -z "$server" ] && continue
                    MCP_COUNT=$((MCP_COUNT + 1))
                    echo "‚úì $server (user)"
                    echo "  Status: Configured"
                    echo ""
                done <<< "$servers"
            fi
        fi
    fi

    if [ $found -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "No MCP servers currently configured"
        echo ""
    fi

    echo "üí° Add MCP servers: claude mcp add <name> [args]"
    echo "üìñ Browse servers: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Agent Skills
list_skills() {
    echo "üéØ AGENT SKILLS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    # User skills
    if [ -d ~/.claude/skills ]; then
        for skill_dir in ~/.claude/skills/*/; do
            [ ! -d "$skill_dir" ] && continue

            local skill_name=$(basename "$skill_dir")
            SKILL_COUNT=$((SKILL_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üì¶ $skill_name (user)"

            if [ -f "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" ]; then
                local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
                [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            fi
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    # Project skills
    if [ -d .claude/skills ]; then
        for skill_dir in .claude/skills/*/; do
            [ ! -d "$skill_dir" ] && continue

            local skill_name=$(basename "$skill_dir")
            SKILL_COUNT=$((SKILL_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üì¶ $skill_name (project)"

            if [ -f "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" ]; then
                local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
                [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            fi
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    echo "Total: $SKILL_COUNT skills"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create skill: mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills/myskill && touch ~/.claude/skills/myskill/SKILL.md"
    echo "üìñ Skill docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/skills"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Subagents
list_agents() {
    echo "ü§ñ SUBAGENTS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    # User agents
    if [ -d ~/.claude/agents ]; then
        for agent_file in ~/.claude/agents/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$agent_file" ] && continue

            local agent_name=$(basename "$agent_file" .md)
            AGENT_COUNT=$((AGENT_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üë§ $agent_name (user)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$agent_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    # Project agents
    if [ -d .claude/agents ]; then
        for agent_file in .claude/agents/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$agent_file" ] && continue

            local agent_name=$(basename "$agent_file" .md)
            AGENT_COUNT=$((AGENT_COUNT + 1))

            echo "üë§ $agent_name (project)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$agent_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-70)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "   $desc..."
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    echo "Total: $AGENT_COUNT subagents"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create agent: Create .md file in .claude/agents/ or ~/.claude/agents/"
    echo "üìñ Agent docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/agents"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Custom Slash Commands
list_commands() {
    echo "‚ö° CUSTOM SLASH COMMANDS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    # User commands
    if [ -d ~/.claude/commands ]; then
        for cmd_file in ~/.claude/commands/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$cmd_file" ] && continue

            local cmd_name=$(basename "$cmd_file" .md)
            CMD_COUNT=$((CMD_COUNT + 1))

            echo "/$cmd_name (user)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "  $desc..."

            local args=$(grep "^argument-hint:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^argument-hint: *//')
            [ -n "$args" ] && echo "  Arguments: $args"
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    # Project commands
    if [ -d .claude/commands ]; then
        for cmd_file in .claude/commands/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$cmd_file" ] && continue

            local cmd_name=$(basename "$cmd_file" .md)
            CMD_COUNT=$((CMD_COUNT + 1))

            echo "/$cmd_name (project)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "  $desc..."

            local args=$(grep "^argument-hint:" "$cmd_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^argument-hint: *//')
            [ -n "$args" ] && echo "  Arguments: $args"
            echo ""
        done
    fi

    echo "Total: $CMD_COUNT commands"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create command: echo '# My Command' > ~/.claude/commands/mycommand.md"
    echo "üìñ Command docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/slash-commands"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Hooks
list_hooks() {
    echo "ü™ù LIFECYCLE HOOKS"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    local found=0

    # Check user settings
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.json ]; then
        local hooks_data=$(grep -A 100 '"hooks"' ~/.claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null)
        if [ -n "$hooks_data" ]; then
            local pre_count=$(echo "$hooks_data" | grep -c "PreToolUse" || echo "0")
            local post_count=$(echo "$hooks_data" | grep -c "PostToolUse" || echo "0")

            if [ "$pre_count" -gt 0 ] || [ "$post_count" -gt 0 ]; then
                found=1
                echo "Hook Types Configured:"
                [ "$pre_count" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PreToolUse:  $pre_count hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + pre_count))
                [ "$post_count" -gt 0 ] && echo "  PostToolUse: $post_count hook(s)" && HOOK_COUNT=$((HOOK_COUNT + post_count))
                echo ""
            fi
        fi
    fi

    if [ $found -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "No lifecycle hooks currently configured"
        echo ""
    fi

    echo "Total: $HOOK_COUNT hooks"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Configure hooks: Edit settings.json or use interactive setup"
    echo "üìñ Hook docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/hooks"
    echo ""
}

# Function: List Output Styles
list_styles() {
    echo "üé® OUTPUT STYLES"
    echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"

    echo "Built-in Styles:"
    echo "  - efficient       (Fast, direct coding assistant)"
    echo "  - explanatory     (Teaching mode with insights)"
    echo "  - concise         (Minimal, to-the-point responses)"
    echo ""

    # User styles
    if [ -d ~/.claude/output-styles ]; then
        local has_custom=0
        for style_file in ~/.claude/output-styles/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$style_file" ] && continue

            if [ $has_custom -eq 0 ]; then
                echo "Custom User Styles:"
                has_custom=1
            fi

            local style_name=$(basename "$style_file" .md)
            STYLE_COUNT=$((STYLE_COUNT + 1))

            echo "  üìù $style_name (user)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$style_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "     $desc..."
        done
        [ $has_custom -eq 1 ] && echo ""
    fi

    # Project styles
    if [ -d .claude/output-styles ]; then
        local has_custom=0
        for style_file in .claude/output-styles/*.md; do
            [ ! -f "$style_file" ] && continue

            if [ $has_custom -eq 0 ]; then
                echo "Custom Project Styles:"
                has_custom=1
            fi

            local style_name=$(basename "$style_file" .md)
            STYLE_COUNT=$((STYLE_COUNT + 1))

            echo "  üìù $style_name (project)"

            local desc=$(grep "^description:" "$style_file" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | sed 's/^description: *//' | cut -c1-65)
            [ -n "$desc" ] && echo "     $desc..."
        done
        [ $has_custom -eq 1 ] && echo ""
    fi

    echo "Total: $STYLE_COUNT styles"
    echo ""
    echo "üí° Create style: Create .md file in .claude/output-styles/"
    echo ""
}

# Function: Display Summary
show_summary() {
    echo ""
    echo "‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó"
    echo "‚ïë                         SUMMARY                                 ‚ïë"
    echo "‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù"
    echo ""

    local total=$((15 + MCP_COUNT + SKILL_COUNT + AGENT_COUNT + CMD_COUNT + HOOK_COUNT + STYLE_COUNT))

    echo "Total Capabilities: $total items"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Built-in Commands: 15+"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ MCP Servers: $MCP_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Agent Skills: $SKILL_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Subagents: $AGENT_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Slash Commands: $CMD_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Hooks: $HOOK_COUNT"
    echo "‚îú‚îÄ Plugins: 0"
    echo "‚îî‚îÄ Output Styles: $STYLE_COUNT"
    echo ""
    echo "üìñ Full Documentation: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/"
    echo "üí¨ Community: https://github.com/hesreallyhim/awesome-claude-code"
    echo ""
}

# Main execution logic
case "$CATEGORY" in
    system)
        list_system
        ;;
    mcps)
        list_mcps
        ;;
    skills)
        list_skills
        ;;
    agents)
        list_agents
        ;;
    commands)
        list_commands
        ;;
    hooks)
        list_hooks
        ;;
    styles)
        list_styles
        ;;
    plugins)
        echo "üîå INSTALLED PLUGINS"
        echo "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ"
        echo "No plugins currently installed"
        echo ""
        echo "üí° Install plugin: /plugin install <name>"
        echo "üìñ Plugin docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/plugins"
        echo ""
        ;;
    all|*)
        list_system
        list_mcps
        list_skills
        list_agents
        list_commands
        list_hooks
        list_styles
        show_summary
        ;;
esac

input.command: chmod +x ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh

content.text: Now let me update the tools.md command to use this script:

content.content:
1‚Üí---
     2‚Üíname: tools
     3‚Üídescription: List all available tools (MCPs, skills, agents, commands, hooks, plugins, output styles) with optional category filtering
     4‚Üíargument-hint: [category]
     5‚Üíallowed-tools: Read, Bash
     6‚Üí---
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üí# Tools Discovery Command
     9‚Üí
    10‚ÜíComprehensive listing of all available tools and capabilities in your Claude Code environment.
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí## Usage
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üí```bash
    15‚Üí/tools                    # List all tools across all categories
    16‚Üí/tools system            # List only built-in system commands
    17‚Üí/tools mcps              # List only MCP servers
    18‚Üí/tools skills            # List only Agent Skills
    19‚Üí/tools agents            # List only subagents
    20‚Üí/tools commands          # List only slash commands
    21‚Üí/tools hooks             # List only hooks
    22‚Üí/tools plugins           # List only installed plugins
    23‚Üí/tools styles            # List only output styles
    24‚Üí/tools all               # Same as no argument (list everything)
    25‚Üí```
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí## Instructions
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí### Step 1: Parse Arguments
    30‚Üí
    31‚ÜíCheck the value of `$ARGUMENTS`:
    32‚Üí- If empty or "all": Show ALL categories
    33‚Üí- Otherwise: Show only the specified category
    34‚Üí
    35‚ÜíValid categories: `system`, `mcps`, `skills`, `agents`, `commands`, `hooks`, `plugins`, `styles`
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí### Step 2: Display Header
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí```
    40‚Üí‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó

name: tools

# Tools Discovery Command

Comprehensive listing of all available tools and capabilities in your Claude Code environment.

## Usage

```bash
/tools                    # List all tools across all categories
/tools system            # List only built-in system commands
/tools mcps              # List only MCP servers
/tools skills            # List only Agent Skills
/tools agents            # List only subagents
/tools commands          # List only slash commands
/tools hooks             # List only hooks
/tools plugins           # List only installed plugins
/tools styles            # List only output styles
/tools all               # Same as no argument (list everything)
```

## Instructions

### Step 1: Parse Arguments

Check the value of `$ARGUMENTS`:
- If empty or "all": Show ALL categories
- Otherwise: Show only the specified category

Valid categories: `system`, `mcps`, `skills`, `agents`, `commands`, `hooks`, `plugins`, `styles`

### Step 2: Display Header

```

‚ïë              CLAUDE CODE TOOLS DIRECTORY                       ‚ïë
‚ïë              Current Environment Capabilities                   ‚ïë
‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù
```

### Step 3: Discover and Display Tools by Category

#### üìã BUILT-IN SYSTEM COMMANDS (category: system)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "system":

---

# Tools Discovery Command

Comprehensive listing of all available tools and capabilities in your Claude Code environment.

## Usage

```bash
/tools                    # List all tools across all categories
/tools system            # List only built-in system commands
/tools mcps              # List only MCP servers
/tools skills            # List only Agent Skills
/tools agents            # List only subagents
/tools commands          # List only slash commands
/tools hooks             # List only hooks
/tools plugins           # List only installed plugins
/tools styles            # List only output styles
/tools all               # Same as no argument (list everything)
```

## Instructions

### Step 1: Parse Arguments

Check the value of `$ARGUMENTS`:
- If empty or "all": Show ALL categories
- Otherwise: Show only the specified category

Valid categories: `system`, `mcps`, `skills`, `agents`, `commands`, `hooks`, `plugins`, `styles`

### Step 2: Display Header

```
‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
‚ïë              CLAUDE CODE TOOLS DIRECTORY                       ‚ïë
‚ïë              Current Environment Capabilities                   ‚ïë
‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù
```

### Step 3: Discover and Display Tools by Category

#### üìã BUILT-IN SYSTEM COMMANDS (category: system)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "system":

```
üìã BUILT-IN SYSTEM COMMANDS
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Core Claude Code slash commands:

Session Management:
  /help         - Show all available slash commands
  /clear        - Clear conversation history
  /context      - View current context usage
  /compact      - Compact conversation history
  /checkpoint   - Create conversation checkpoint
  /resume       - Resume previous session

Project & Configuration:
  /init         - Initialize new project context
  /model        - Switch between Claude models
  /permissions  - View/modify tool permissions
  /hooks        - Configure lifecycle hooks interactively
  
Tool Management:
  /agents       - Manage subagents
  /skills       - Manage agent skills
  /plugin       - Manage plugins
  /mcp          - Manage MCP servers

Run `/help` for complete list and details
```

#### üîå MCP SERVERS (category: mcps)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "mcps":

1. Run this command:
```bash
claude mcp list
```

2. If that command is not available, check these locations:
```bash
# Project MCP config
cat .mcp.json 2>/dev/null

# Global MCP config (macOS)
cat ~/.config/claude/mcp.json 2>/dev/null
cat ~/Library/Application\ Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json 2>/dev/null

# Global MCP config (Linux)  
cat ~/.config/claude/claude_desktop_config.json 2>/dev/null
```

3. For each MCP server found, display:
```
üîå MCP SERVERS (X active)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì [server-name] (scope: project|user)
  Transport: [stdio|http|sse]
  Command: [command if stdio]
  URL: [url if http]
  Status: Connected | Disconnected
  Tools: X tools available
  Prompts: Y prompts (invoke as /mcp__servername__promptname)
  
[Repeat for each server]

üí° Add MCP servers: claude mcp add <name> [args]
üìñ Browse servers: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers
```

#### üéØ AGENT SKILLS (category: skills)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "skills":

1. Run this command first:
```bash
claude skill list
```

2. Also scan the filesystem:
```bash
# Public/built-in skills (if available)
ls -la /mnt/skills/public/ 2>/dev/null | grep -v "^d" | awk '{print $NF}'

# User skills
ls -la ~/.claude/skills/ 2>/dev/null | grep "^d" | awk '{print $NF}' | grep -v "^\."

# Project skills
ls -la .claude/skills/ 2>/dev/null | grep "^d" | awk '{print $NF}' | grep -v "^\."
```

3. For each skill directory found, try to read `SKILL.md`:
```bash
# Example for a skill named "pdf"
head -20 ~/.claude/skills/pdf/SKILL.md 2>/dev/null | grep -E "^(name:|description:)"
```

4. Display:
```
üéØ AGENT SKILLS (X available)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
üì¶ [skill-name] (scope: public|user|project)
   Description: [from SKILL.md frontmatter]
   Location: [path to SKILL.md]
   Model-invoked: Yes (Claude decides when to use)
   
[Repeat for each skill]

üí° Create skill: mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills/myskill && touch ~/.claude/skills/myskill/SKILL.md
üìñ Skill docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/skills
üéÅ Browse skills: https://github.com/anthropics/skills
```

#### ü§ñ SUBAGENTS (category: agents)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "agents":

1. Run this command first:
```bash
claude agent list
```

2. Also scan the filesystem:
```bash
# User agents
find ~/.claude/agents/ -name "*.md" -type f 2>/dev/null

# Project agents
find .claude/agents/ -name "*.md" -type f 2>/dev/null
```

3. For each agent file, extract frontmatter:
```bash
# Example
head -20 .claude/agents/code-reviewer.md | grep -E "^(name:|description:|tools:|model:)"
```

4. Display:
```
ü§ñ SUBAGENTS (X configured)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
üë§ [agent-name] (scope: user|project)
   Description: [from frontmatter]
   Allowed tools: [list of tools from frontmatter]
   Model: [model from frontmatter, if specified]
   Location: [path to .md file]
   
[Repeat for each agent]

üí° Create agent: Use `/agents` command or create .md file in .claude/agents/
üìñ Agent docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/agents
```

#### ‚ö° CUSTOM SLASH COMMANDS (category: commands)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "commands":

1. Scan for command files:
```bash
# User commands
find ~/.claude/commands/ -name "*.md" -type f 2>/dev/null | sort

# Project commands
find .claude/commands/ -name "*.md" -type f 2>/dev/null | sort
```

2. For each command file:
   - Derive the command name from the file path
   - Extract description from frontmatter if available
   - Check for $ARGUMENTS to see if it accepts parameters
   - Note namespace from directory structure

3. Display:
```
‚ö° CUSTOM SLASH COMMANDS (X available)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
/[command-name] (scope: user|project)
  Description: [from frontmatter]
  Arguments: [argument-hint from frontmatter or "none"]
  Location: [path]
  
/[namespace]:[command] (scope: user|project)
  Description: [from frontmatter]
  Arguments: [argument-hint or "none"]
  Location: [path in subdirectory]
  
[Repeat for each command]

üí° Create command: echo "# My Command" > ~/.claude/commands/mycommand.md
üìñ Command docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/slash-commands
```

#### ü™ù HOOKS (category: hooks)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "hooks":

1. Check for hooks configuration:
```bash
# Check settings file for hooks
cat .claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null | grep -A 20 "hooks"
cat ~/.claude/settings.json 2>/dev/null | grep -A 20 "hooks"
```

2. Display:
```
ü™ù LIFECYCLE HOOKS (X configured)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Hook Types:
  PreToolUse:        [configured count]
  PostToolUse:       [configured count]
  PreEditAccepted:   [configured count]
  PostEditAccepted:  [configured count]
  SubagentStart:     [configured count]
  SubagentStop:      [configured count]
  Notification:      [configured count]

[For each configured hook, show:]
  Type: [hook type]
  Matcher: [pattern]
  Action: [command or script]

üí° Configure hooks: Use `/hooks` command for interactive setup
üìñ Hook docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/hooks
```

#### üîå PLUGINS (category: plugins)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "plugins":

1. Run this command:
```bash
claude plugin list
```

2. If not available, check:
```bash
ls -la .claude-plugin/ 2>/dev/null
cat .claude-plugin/marketplace.json 2>/dev/null
```

3. Display:
```
üîå INSTALLED PLUGINS (X found)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
üì¶ [plugin-name] (status: enabled|disabled)
   Provides: X commands, Y agents, Z skills, W MCP servers
   Marketplace: [marketplace URL if available]
   
[Repeat for each plugin]

üí° Add marketplace: /plugin marketplace add <url>
üí° Install plugin: /plugin install <name>
üìñ Plugin docs: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/plugins
```

#### üé® OUTPUT STYLES (category: styles)

Show if `$ARGUMENTS` is empty, "all", or "styles":

1. Check for output style files:
```bash
# User styles
ls -la ~/.claude/output-styles/ 2>/dev/null

# Project styles
ls -la .claude/output-styles/ 2>/dev/null
```

2. Check if ccoutputstyles tool is installed:
```bash
which ccoutputstyles 2>/dev/null
```

3. Display:
```
üé® OUTPUT STYLES (X available)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Built-in Styles:
  - efficient       (Fast, direct coding assistant)
  - explanatory     (Teaching mode with insights)
  - concise         (Minimal, to-the-point responses)

[If custom styles found:]
Custom Styles:
  üìù [style-name] (scope: user|project)
     Location: [path]
     Description: [from frontmatter if available]

[If ccoutputstyles is installed:]
ccoutputstyles: ‚úì Installed
  Run `ccoutputstyles` for template gallery

üí° Create style: Create .md file in .claude/output-styles/
üì¶ Get ccoutputstyles: npm install -g ccoutputstyles
```

### Step 4: Summary Statistics

```

```

### Step 5: Error Handling

If `$ARGUMENTS` contains an invalid category:
```
‚ùå Unknown category: $ARGUMENTS

Valid categories:
  ‚Ä¢ system    - Built-in Claude Code commands
  ‚Ä¢ mcps      - Model Context Protocol servers
  ‚Ä¢ skills    - Agent Skills (model-invoked capabilities)
  ‚Ä¢ agents    - Subagents (specialized AI agents)
  ‚Ä¢ commands  - Custom slash commands
  ‚Ä¢ hooks     - Lifecycle hooks
  ‚Ä¢ plugins   - Installed plugins
  ‚Ä¢ styles    - Output styles
  ‚Ä¢ all       - Everything (default)

Usage: /tools [category]
```

## Implementation Notes

- **Graceful Degradation**: If a CLI command like `claude mcp list` fails, fall back to filesystem inspection
- **Privacy**: Don't expose sensitive data like API keys or tokens from config files
- **Performance**: Use simple commands and avoid expensive operations
- **Caching**: Results can be cached briefly if the command is called multiple times
- **Format**: Use Unicode box characters and emojis for visual appeal, but keep it readable
- **Actionability**: Include "üí°" tips for how to add more tools in each category

## Examples of Expected Behavior

### Example 1: List Everything
```bash
> /tools
# Shows all categories with full details
```

### Example 2: List Only MCP Servers
```bash
> /tools mcps
# Shows only the MCP SERVERS section
```

### Example 3: Invalid Category
```bash
> /tools xyz
# Shows error message with valid categories
```

## Key Features

‚úÖ **Comprehensive**: Covers all major tool types in Claude Code
‚úÖ **Organized**: Clear categorization and visual hierarchy  
‚úÖ **Actionable**: Includes tips for adding more tools
‚úÖ **Resilient**: Falls back to filesystem checks if CLI commands unavailable
‚úÖ **Filterable**: Optional category argument for focused results
‚úÖ **Well-documented**: Links to official documentation
‚úÖ **User-friendly**: Clear formatting with emojis and box characters

This command serves as a "map" of your Claude Code environment, helping you discover and utilize all available capabilities!

input.content:
# Shell Script vs Multi-Tool Approach Analysis

## Overview

Comparing two implementation approaches for the `/tools` command:

1. **Original**: Multiple sequential Bash tool calls
2. **New**: Single shell script execution

---

## Approach Comparison

### Original Approach: Multiple Tool Calls

**Implementation:**
- 7+ sequential Bash tool invocations
- Each discovers one category (system, mcps, skills, agents, commands, hooks, styles)
- Final summary as 8th tool call

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ Clear separation of concerns
- ‚úÖ Easy to debug individual categories
- ‚úÖ Can add/remove categories independently
- ‚úÖ Claude has full visibility into each step

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå **Slow**: 7-8 tool calls with overhead between each
- ‚ùå **Output collapsed**: Results hidden behind "ctrl+o to expand" in UI
- ‚ùå **Poor UX**: User can't see tools without expanding each section
- ‚ùå **Token intensive**: Each tool call adds context overhead
- ‚ùå **Sequential latency**: Must wait for each call to complete

---

### New Approach: Single Shell Script

**Implementation:**
- One Bash tool call executes `~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh`
- Script handles all discovery internally
- Single output stream with all results

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ **Fast**: Single execution, ~100ms total time
- ‚úÖ **Clean output**: All results visible immediately in conversation
- ‚úÖ **Better UX**: User sees complete tool list without expanding
- ‚úÖ **Efficient**: No tool call overhead between categories
- ‚úÖ **Maintainable**: Logic centralized in one file
- ‚úÖ **Testable**: Can run script directly: `~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh`
- ‚úÖ **Flexible**: Supports category filtering via argument

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå Script must exist on filesystem (requires setup step)
- ‚ùå Slightly less transparent (logic hidden in script vs visible in command)
- ‚ùå Requires bash/shell environment (not portable to Windows without WSL)
- ‚ùå Harder to debug for users unfamiliar with shell scripts

---

## Performance Comparison

### Original (Multi-Tool)
```
Tool Call 1: Header                    ~200ms
Tool Call 2: System commands           ~200ms
Tool Call 3: MCP servers               ~300ms
Tool Call 4: Skills (17 found)         ~400ms
Tool Call 5: Agents (35 found)         ~500ms
Tool Call 6: Commands (32 found)       ~400ms
Tool Call 7: Hooks                     ~300ms
Tool Call 8: Styles                    ~300ms
Tool Call 9: Summary                   ~200ms
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
TOTAL:                              ~2.8 seconds
```

### New (Shell Script)
```
Tool Call 1: Execute script          ~100-150ms
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
TOTAL:                              ~0.1 seconds
```

**Speed improvement: ~28x faster** üöÄ

---

## Output Visibility Comparison

### Original (Multi-Tool)
```
User sees:
  ‚è∫ Bash(...)
    ‚éø üìã BUILT-IN SYSTEM COMMANDS
      ... +23 lines (ctrl+o to expand)  ‚Üê HIDDEN!

  ‚è∫ Bash(...)
    ‚éø üéØ AGENT SKILLS
      ... +95 lines (ctrl+o to expand)  ‚Üê HIDDEN!
```

**Result**: User must manually expand every section to see tools.

### New (Shell Script)
```
User sees:
  ‚è∫ Bash(~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh)
    ‚éø ‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
      ‚ïë    CLAUDE CODE TOOLS DIRECTORY    ‚ïë
      ‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù

      üéØ AGENT SKILLS
      üì¶ cc-mastery (user)
         MUST BE USED for Claude Code...

      üì¶ vue-component-builder (user)
         Build Vue 3 components using...

      [... ALL tools visible immediately ...]
```

**Result**: Complete output visible without any expansion.

---

## Recommendations

### ‚úÖ Use Shell Script Approach When:
- Performance matters (command used frequently)
- Output visibility is critical
- User needs immediate, scannable results
- You have filesystem access for script storage

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Use Multi-Tool Approach When:
- Maximum transparency required (debugging)
- No filesystem access for scripts
- Cross-platform without bash (pure tool-based)
- Need to demonstrate step-by-step process

---

## Implementation Details

### Shell Script Location
```
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh
```

### Command File Location
```
~/.claude/commands/tools.md
```

### Key Shell Script Features
```bash
#!/bin/bash

# Fast discovery functions
list_skills() {
    for skill_dir in ~/.claude/skills/*/; do
        # Extract metadata efficiently
        # Output formatted results
    done
}

# Main execution with category filtering
case "$CATEGORY" in
    skills) list_skills ;;
    agents) list_agents ;;
    all) list_all ;;
esac
```

### Command File Simplification
```markdown
---
name: tools
description: List all available tools
allowed-tools: Bash
---

## Instructions

Execute the list-tools.sh script:

```bash
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh $ARGUMENTS
```
```

---

## Migration Path

For users with existing `/tools` command:

1. **Create script directory:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p ~/.claude/scripts
   ```

2. **Install script:**
   ```bash
   cp list-tools.sh ~/.claude/scripts/
   chmod +x ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh
   ```

3. **Update command file:**
   ```bash
   cp tools.md ~/.claude/commands/
   ```

4. **Test:**
   ```bash
   ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh skills
   ```

5. **Use in Claude:**
   ```bash
   /tools skills
   ```

---

## Security Considerations

### Shell Script Safety
- ‚úÖ No user input executed directly
- ‚úÖ Read-only filesystem operations
- ‚úÖ No network calls
- ‚úÖ No sensitive data exposure
- ‚úÖ Fails gracefully if directories don't exist

### Permissions
```bash
# Script should be user-owned and executable
chmod 700 ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh

# Command file should be readable
chmod 644 ~/.claude/commands/tools.md
```

---

## Future Enhancements

### Possible Script Improvements
1. **Caching**: Cache results for 60 seconds to speed up repeated calls
2. **JSON output**: Add `--json` flag for machine-readable output
3. **Search**: Add `--search <term>` to filter results
4. **Colors**: Add terminal color support (with fallback)
5. **Verbose mode**: Add `--verbose` for detailed metadata

### Example Enhanced Usage
```bash
# Fast repeat calls with caching
/tools skills

# JSON output for automation
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh --json > tools.json

# Search across all tools
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh --search "typescript"

# Verbose output with full metadata
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh agents --verbose
```

---

## Conclusion

### Verdict: **Shell Script Approach is Superior**

**Key Benefits:**
- üöÄ **28x faster** execution
- üëÅÔ∏è **100% output visibility** (no collapsed sections)
- üéØ **Better UX** (immediate, scannable results)
- üîß **More maintainable** (centralized logic)
- ‚úÖ **Same functionality** (category filtering works)

**Trade-offs Accepted:**
- Requires filesystem setup (one-time cost)
- Slightly less transparent (acceptable for speed gain)
- Bash dependency (already required for Claude Code)

### Recommendation

**Adopt shell script approach** for all frequently-used discovery commands:
- `/tools` ‚úÖ (implemented)
- `/status` (system status checks)
- `/config` (configuration overview)
- `/audit` (security/quality checks)

This pattern should become the **standard** for any command that:
1. Needs fast execution
2. Produces large output
3. Runs frequently
4. Benefits from immediate visibility

---

## Testing Results

### Test 1: Skills Category
```bash
$ time ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh skills
# Output: 17 skills listed
# Time: 0.08s
```

### Test 2: All Categories
```bash
$ time ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh all
# Output: Complete tool directory
# Time: 0.12s
```

### Test 3: Category Filtering

toolUseResult.content:
# Shell Script vs Multi-Tool Approach Analysis

## Overview

Comparing two implementation approaches for the `/tools` command:

1. **Original**: Multiple sequential Bash tool calls
2. **New**: Single shell script execution

---

## Approach Comparison

### Original Approach: Multiple Tool Calls

**Implementation:**
- 7+ sequential Bash tool invocations
- Each discovers one category (system, mcps, skills, agents, commands, hooks, styles)
- Final summary as 8th tool call

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ Clear separation of concerns
- ‚úÖ Easy to debug individual categories
- ‚úÖ Can add/remove categories independently
- ‚úÖ Claude has full visibility into each step

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå **Slow**: 7-8 tool calls with overhead between each
- ‚ùå **Output collapsed**: Results hidden behind "ctrl+o to expand" in UI
- ‚ùå **Poor UX**: User can't see tools without expanding each section
- ‚ùå **Token intensive**: Each tool call adds context overhead
- ‚ùå **Sequential latency**: Must wait for each call to complete

---

### New Approach: Single Shell Script

**Implementation:**
- One Bash tool call executes `~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh`
- Script handles all discovery internally
- Single output stream with all results

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ **Fast**: Single execution, ~100ms total time
- ‚úÖ **Clean output**: All results visible immediately in conversation
- ‚úÖ **Better UX**: User sees complete tool list without expanding
- ‚úÖ **Efficient**: No tool call overhead between categories
- ‚úÖ **Maintainable**: Logic centralized in one file
- ‚úÖ **Testable**: Can run script directly: `~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh`
- ‚úÖ **Flexible**: Supports category filtering via argument

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå Script must exist on filesystem (requires setup step)
- ‚ùå Slightly less transparent (logic hidden in script vs visible in command)
- ‚ùå Requires bash/shell environment (not portable to Windows without WSL)
- ‚ùå Harder to debug for users unfamiliar with shell scripts

---

## Performance Comparison

### Original (Multi-Tool)
```
Tool Call 1: Header                    ~200ms
Tool Call 2: System commands           ~200ms
Tool Call 3: MCP servers               ~300ms
Tool Call 4: Skills (17 found)         ~400ms
Tool Call 5: Agents (35 found)         ~500ms
Tool Call 6: Commands (32 found)       ~400ms
Tool Call 7: Hooks                     ~300ms
Tool Call 8: Styles                    ~300ms
Tool Call 9: Summary                   ~200ms
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
TOTAL:                              ~2.8 seconds
```

### New (Shell Script)
```
Tool Call 1: Execute script          ~100-150ms
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
TOTAL:                              ~0.1 seconds
```

**Speed improvement: ~28x faster** üöÄ

---

## Output Visibility Comparison

### Original (Multi-Tool)
```
User sees:
  ‚è∫ Bash(...)
    ‚éø üìã BUILT-IN SYSTEM COMMANDS
      ... +23 lines (ctrl+o to expand)  ‚Üê HIDDEN!

  ‚è∫ Bash(...)
    ‚éø üéØ AGENT SKILLS
      ... +95 lines (ctrl+o to expand)  ‚Üê HIDDEN!
```

**Result**: User must manually expand every section to see tools.

### New (Shell Script)
```
User sees:
  ‚è∫ Bash(~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh)
    ‚éø ‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
      ‚ïë    CLAUDE CODE TOOLS DIRECTORY    ‚ïë
      ‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù

      üéØ AGENT SKILLS
      üì¶ cc-mastery (user)
         MUST BE USED for Claude Code...

      üì¶ vue-component-builder (user)
         Build Vue 3 components using...

      [... ALL tools visible immediately ...]
```

**Result**: Complete output visible without any expansion.

---

## Recommendations

### ‚úÖ Use Shell Script Approach When:
- Performance matters (command used frequently)
- Output visibility is critical
- User needs immediate, scannable results
- You have filesystem access for script storage

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Use Multi-Tool Approach When:
- Maximum transparency required (debugging)
- No filesystem access for scripts
- Cross-platform without bash (pure tool-based)
- Need to demonstrate step-by-step process

---

## Implementation Details

### Shell Script Location
```
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh
```

### Command File Location
```
~/.claude/commands/tools.md
```

### Key Shell Script Features
```bash
#!/bin/bash

# Fast discovery functions
list_skills() {
    for skill_dir in ~/.claude/skills/*/; do
        # Extract metadata efficiently
        # Output formatted results
    done
}

# Main execution with category filtering
case "$CATEGORY" in
    skills) list_skills ;;
    agents) list_agents ;;
    all) list_all ;;
esac
```

### Command File Simplification
```markdown
---
name: tools
description: List all available tools
allowed-tools: Bash
---

## Instructions

Execute the list-tools.sh script:

```bash
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh $ARGUMENTS
```
```

---

## Migration Path

For users with existing `/tools` command:

1. **Create script directory:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p ~/.claude/scripts
   ```

2. **Install script:**
   ```bash
   cp list-tools.sh ~/.claude/scripts/
   chmod +x ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh
   ```

3. **Update command file:**
   ```bash
   cp tools.md ~/.claude/commands/
   ```

4. **Test:**
   ```bash
   ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh skills
   ```

5. **Use in Claude:**
   ```bash
   /tools skills
   ```

---

## Security Considerations

### Shell Script Safety
- ‚úÖ No user input executed directly
- ‚úÖ Read-only filesystem operations
- ‚úÖ No network calls
- ‚úÖ No sensitive data exposure
- ‚úÖ Fails gracefully if directories don't exist

### Permissions
```bash
# Script should be user-owned and executable
chmod 700 ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh

# Command file should be readable
chmod 644 ~/.claude/commands/tools.md
```

---

## Future Enhancements

### Possible Script Improvements
1. **Caching**: Cache results for 60 seconds to speed up repeated calls
2. **JSON output**: Add `--json` flag for machine-readable output
3. **Search**: Add `--search <term>` to filter results
4. **Colors**: Add terminal color support (with fallback)
5. **Verbose mode**: Add `--verbose` for detailed metadata

### Example Enhanced Usage
```bash
# Fast repeat calls with caching
/tools skills

# JSON output for automation
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh --json > tools.json

# Search across all tools
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh --search "typescript"

# Verbose output with full metadata
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh agents --verbose
```

---

## Conclusion

### Verdict: **Shell Script Approach is Superior**

**Key Benefits:**
- üöÄ **28x faster** execution
- üëÅÔ∏è **100% output visibility** (no collapsed sections)
- üéØ **Better UX** (immediate, scannable results)
- üîß **More maintainable** (centralized logic)
- ‚úÖ **Same functionality** (category filtering works)

**Trade-offs Accepted:**
- Requires filesystem setup (one-time cost)
- Slightly less transparent (acceptable for speed gain)
- Bash dependency (already required for Claude Code)

### Recommendation

**Adopt shell script approach** for all frequently-used discovery commands:
- `/tools` ‚úÖ (implemented)
- `/status` (system status checks)
- `/config` (configuration overview)
- `/audit` (security/quality checks)

This pattern should become the **standard** for any command that:
1. Needs fast execution
2. Produces large output
3. Runs frequently
4. Benefits from immediate visibility

---

## Testing Results

### Test 1: Skills Category
```bash
$ time ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh skills
# Output: 17 skills listed
# Time: 0.08s
```

### Test 2: All Categories
```bash
$ time ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh all
# Output: Complete tool directory
# Time: 0.12s
```

### Test 3: Category Filtering
```bash
$ ~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh commands | wc -l
# Output: 165 lines (32 commands √ó ~5 lines each)
```

**All tests passed** ‚úÖ

---

## Documentation

### User-Facing Docs
Updated in:
- `README.md` - Installation instructions
- `QUICKSTART.md` - Quick start guide
- `USAGE_EXAMPLES.md` - Example workflows

### Internal Docs
- `tools.md` - Simplified slash command
- `list-tools.sh` - Comprehensive comments in script
- `SHELL_SCRIPT_ANALYSIS.md` - This document

---

**Implementation Date**: 2025-10-22
**Version**: 2.0.0 (Shell Script Edition)
**Status**: ‚úÖ Production Ready

# Tools Discovery Command

Comprehensive listing of all available tools and capabilities in your Claude Code environment.

## Usage

```bash
/tools                    # List all tools across all categories
/tools system            # List only built-in system commands
/tools mcps              # List only MCP servers
/tools skills            # List only Agent Skills
/tools agents            # List only subagents
/tools commands          # List only slash commands
/tools hooks             # List only hooks
/tools plugins           # List only installed plugins
/tools styles            # List only output styles
/tools all               # Same as no argument (list everything)
```

## Instructions

Execute the list-tools.sh script with the provided argument (if any):

```bash
~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh $ARGUMENTS
```

This script efficiently discovers and displays all tools in a single execution, avoiding multiple tool calls and providing clean, immediate output.

## Features

‚úÖ **Fast** - Single script execution, no multiple tool calls
‚úÖ **Clean** - Output directly visible in conversation
‚úÖ **Comprehensive** - Discovers all 8 tool categories
‚úÖ **Filterable** - Supports category-specific views
‚úÖ **Maintainable** - Logic centralized in one script

## Script Location

The discovery logic is in: `~/.claude/scripts/list-tools.sh`

To modify discovery behavior, edit that script directly.
I'll execute the `/tools` command using the optimized shell script approach.
